questions.question: The nettle plant has spines that protect it against animals.
All plants need roots to obtain nutrients in order to live and grow.
Some plants digest animals to supplement the nutrients they get from the soil.
Plants make their own food by using the sunlight to make salt.
During photosynthesis, all plants make the same kind of sugar.
When plants make food, they release oxygen into the air.
Which of the following is correct about how plants relate to animals in the Earth’s system?

choices.answer: Plants take in nitrogen that is given by animal respiration.
Plants take in carbon dioxide given by animals, fungi, etc.
Animals use carbon dioxide that is given by plants.
Plants depend on animals for sunlight.

questions.question: Which of the following methods is used by plants to disperse their seeds widely?

choices.answer: Traveling through an animal’s digestive system

questions.question: Which of the following are correct structures and functions of desert plants?

choices.answer: Desert plants can store water in their fleshy stems and pads
Cactus spines are used to attract animals.
The cactus spines are excellent at releasing water.

questions.question: Which of the following correctly explains how the plant obtains its energy?

choices.answer: Plants get their energy from an extensive root system.
Energy enters a plant when sunlights trapped by chlorophyll.
Energy is obtained when carbon dioxide is changed into sugar
